sentences.en: A new virtuoso has come to the fore.
sentences.cn: 已成为显赫人物的新艺术品鉴赏家

sentences.en: A number of low-budget independent films brought new directors and actors to the fore.
sentences.cn: 许多低成本独立制作的电影使新导演和新演员崭露头角。

sentences.en: A wicked, mordant sense of humour has come to the fore in Blur's world.
sentences.cn: 布勒的世界里已出现了一种恶意、刻薄的幽默感。

sentences.en: At the championships more promising divers are expected to come to the fore.
sentences.cn: 在这次比赛中,估计将会涌现更多优秀的跳水运动员.

sentences.en: He loosened his very strong hold on the ship's rail and glanced fore and aft.
sentences.cn: 他松开紧紧抓住护栏的手，往船的两头扫了一眼。

sentences.en: He went fore to see whether the sail was properly in place.
sentences.cn: 他走到船头看帆是否挂好了.

sentences.en: Our yacht was well equipped with two double cabins fore and aft.
sentences.cn: 我们的游艇设施完备，首尾有两个双人舱。

sentences.en: Possessed of such qualities, how do you bring them to the fore and snare the job?
sentences.cn: 既然具备了这些优秀素质，你该怎样把它们充分展示出来并谋得这份工作呢？

sentences.en: She came alongside and raked him fore and aft.
sentences.cn: 她倒对他展开近战,全面开火.

sentences.en: The captain ordered two flags to be placed fore and aft.
sentences.cn: 船长命令在船首船尾都挂旗.

sentences.en: The fore end tube plate of the condenser has cracked beyond repair.
sentences.cn: 冷凝器前端破裂得无法修理了.

sentences.en: The Fore knew kuru as a curse cast by sorcerers.
sentences.cn: 弗尔族人认为,库鲁是由男巫发出的诅咒.

sentences.en: There had been no direct damage in the fore part of the ship.
sentences.cn: 没有对船的前部造成直接损坏。

sentences.en: They are putting the powder and the arms in the fore hold.
sentences.cn: 他们正在把火药和武器搬进前舱.

sentences.en: This factor will come increasingly to the fore as election day nears.
sentences.cn: 随着选举日的临近，这一因素将愈发重要。

sentences.en: This innervate the adjacent region of the fore and middle intestine.
sentences.cn: 这就为前肠和中肠的邻接部分提供了神经.

sentences.en: Your seat is in the fore part of the aircraft.
sentences.cn: 你的座位在飞机的前部.

phrases.tran_cn: 出名：处于、进入或朝向一个显赫的位置

trans.tran_en: the fore parts of a ship, plane, or animal are the parts at the front
at or towards the front of a ship or an aircraft
